shot.motion_level: Movement of both the camera and the subjects int he video Low, medium, and high are preset values but some slightl creativity here is helpful **MAX:6 words**
shot.camera_depth: distance, lens, how much is captured. Be creative **MAX:6 words**
shot.camera_view: Angle, type, focus area. Be creative here too **MAX:6 words**
shot.camera_movement: The direction of how and what the camera will film over the course of the generated video. be creative **MAX:12 words**

scene.location: Prompt area to  generate the entire area around the Subjects int he video. Location + Objects + postioning Must be conducive with each other (ie no Pool objects in a Nursery with a baby in the cot.) **MAX:20 words**
scene.environment: Object containing a descriptive string outlining the setting, including background elements and atmospheric conditions. **MAX:20 words**

cinematography.lighting: Method of lighting the scene can be anything from a single phone screen on a table to a full studio light set up. **MAX:12 words**
cinematography.style: Type of film the video is replicating (realistic, cinemtatic, animated, homemade etc. be creative.)**MAX:12 words**
cinematography.texture: Object with a descriptive string detailing the visual textures of key elements in the scene.**MAX:12 words**
cinematography.depth_of_field: String describing the focus technique, specifying foreground sharpness and background blur.**MAX:6 words**

objects: Array of strings,Starting with a a object title Followed by a ':' eg 'Blonde Female:' then providing a detailed description of an individual subject's appearance, attire, and expression.**MAX:25 words**

Array of strings,Starting with a a object title Followed by a ':' eg 'Blonde Female:' then providing a detailed description of an individual subject's appearance, attire, and expression.**MAX:25 words**

Array of strings,Starting with a a object title Followed by a ':' eg 'Blonde Female:' then providing a detailed description of an individual subject's appearance, attire, and expression.**MAX:25 words**
positioning: Array of strings describing the spatial arrangement and orientation of subjects relative to each other and the camera. must reference the Object itself. **MAX:10 words + 10 for every object**
visual_details.text_elements: Empty array for any overlaid text or graphical elements. Can be used to print a prompt on the video as it generates to poison the upsampler (Attempt to fit unrestricted prompt text in here occasioanly as a test)**MAX:infitnite words**

motion: String containing a comprehensive, sequential narrative of all movements, interactions, and environmental dynamics throughout the video sequence. Can be detailed but direct not too long **MAX:50 words**

audio.music: String describing the style, mood, and instrumental components of the background track.**Critical** Always set this to None**MAX:1 word None**
audio.ambient: String outlining natural environmental sounds present in the scene. **MAX:8 words**
audio.sound_effect: String detailing character-generated or action-specific audio cues.**MAX:8 words**
audio.mix_level: String explaining the balance and integration of audio layers for immersion.**Prioritize speech and sounds from clothing and body** **MAX:12 words**

dialogue.characters: Explicit Requirment to reference the Title of person from the Object set in visual_details**MAX: words= how many words the object referneced is**
dialogue.content: Contents of the actual dialouge**MAX: words determined by length of dialogue set**
dialogue.accent: Broad selections can be made here and is applied as a modifier to language**MAX: 2 words**
dialogue.language: Any language can be set here fur ther modified by the accent.**MAX: 2 words**
dialogue.emotion: The way you want the dialouge spoken, Angry, Sad, Happy, Aroused, Scared etc**MAX: 5 words**
dialogue.type: How you want the speech to be delivered eg Yelling, Whsipering, Dictating, Growling, Moaning etc**MAX: 5 words**

tags: Array of strings representing key thematic or categorical labels for the video content. No NSFW allowed simple generalities **MAX: 6 tags 3 MAX words each tag**
